question: parents should spend more time with their children helping them with their homework. Do you agree or disagree?
text: It is often argued that how can be valuable to involve parents in the teaching process of their children such as helping them to do their exercises. In my opinion, I completely disagree with this view and believe that it would be better for students to be responsible for their own study tasks and actions .

Firstly , youngsters whose parents help them in their exercises may do not learn to be responsible. In other words, If scholars try to perform their lessons and home assignments by themselves , they will undoubtedly be able to cope with difficult and unpleasant situations  by developing useful skills such as perseverance and tenacity . Consequently , this method can effects positively their future and make them able to face   real -life. For example, many researchers demonstrated that youngsters who do not receive  big support in their learning from their families , become more independent and can achieve good marks in their exams . That is why helping too many children in their examinations remain an unfavourable way of education for them .

Secondly,spending much time  helping scholars to do their home tasks can demotivate them from the study. To put it simply , controlling every step and even doing exercises for pupils can discourage them from  learning .However, scholars whose fathers or mothers do not much  involved in their education have a bigger desire to learn more and get new knowledge .Therefore, the parent's assistance makes students feel stressed and uncomfortable in their examinations . Thus , this approach should be avoided in education .

In conclusion , although that supporting pupils in their studies can be helpful for them , I believe that the most beneficial way of learning for them is  to be not dependent on their families  in their studies.
